title: I Am...I Said
lyrics: L.A.'s fine, the sun shines most the timeAnd the feeling is 'lay back'Palm trees grow, and rents are lowBut you know I keep thinkin' aboutMaking my way backWell I'm New York City born and raisedBut nowadays, I'm lost between two shoresL.A.'s fine, but it ain't homeNew York's home, but it ain't mine no more"I am," I said, to no one thereAnd no one heard at allNot even the chair"I am," I cried "I am," said IAnd I am lost, and I can't even say whyLeavin' me lonely stillDid you ever read about a frog who dreamed of bein' a kingAnd then became oneWell except for the names and a few other changesIf you talk about me, the story's the same oneBut I got an emptiness deep insideAnd I've tried, but it won't let me goAnd I'm not a man who likes to swearBut I never cared for the sound of being alone"I am," I said to no one thereAnd no one heard at allNot even the chair"I am," I cried "I am," said IAnd I am lost, and I can't even say whyLeavin' me lonely still
